abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Ba'albeck
            Water and Wastewater Project for Lebanon include: 1)
            developing and strengthening the capacity of the water and
            irrigation authorities; 2) improving population coverage and
            customer access to satisfactory water supply and wastewater
            services; 3) involving the private sector in the operation
            and maintenance of the water and wastewater facilities; and
            4) rationalizing the use of water by introducing water
            meters. The closing date for project will be extended from
            June 15, 2011 until June 15, 2012. This will be the third
            extension of the project closing date. The extension of the
            project allowed to increase subscriptions to the water
            network thereby improving the collections rate, and to
            strengthen the Bekaa Region Water Authority's
            (BRWA's) technical and managerial capacity by retaining
            the technical assistance provided by the project management
            unit and service operator.
